entries.body: I went to an interview once where they asked me to build my own Minesweeper. I had 3 hours in the afternoon to myself to build it. I panicked and the end result wasn't very good. Needless to say I didn't get the job... but, I vowed to myself to build it in my own time, and to do it right. This is the result.

I built the voting terminal for The Takeaway's series on America's Greatest Innovation. Every week, two innovations are eliminated based on the lowest number of votes they have received. Users may also submit their own nominations.

entries.dek: the right size for every screen
entries.body: I created the responsive image system we use at Fast Company. I created a React component that generates html5 picture tags with srcset attributes to load in the properly sized assets based on screen width, image width, and screen resolution. The component also converts gif images into video assets to save a large amount of bandwidth usage and contribute to faster load times for users.
entries.tags: React, Cloudinary, html5, images, responsive images, srcset, retina images, lazyloading, gifs, video, Fast Company
